42c027e4ff9730fbb3de84c1af0d2c506e41c3e4:
Daniel Radcliffe turns 18, gains access to £20 million fortune but plans no extravagant spending
Radcliffe can now legally gamble, buy alcohol, and plans a private birthday party
He continues his role as Harry Potter and explores other acting opportunities beyond the franchise
Radcliffe aims to avoid the pitfalls of fame and maintain a grounded lifestyle despite his wealth
ee8871b15c50d0db17b0179a6d2beab35065f1e9:
Miami's "forgotten floor" houses severely mentally ill inmates awaiting trial, often for avoidable felonies
Judge Steven Leifman, an advocate for the mentally ill, highlights the inhumane conditions and systemic failures
Leifman reveals plans to divert inmates to a new mental health facility in 2008, aiming for treatment over punishment
The shift promises benefits for patients, families, and state finances by reducing recidivism and improving justice
06352019a19ae31e527f37f7571c6dd7f0c5da37:
Survivors recount the sudden collapse of the Minneapolis bridge, describing a 30- to 35-foot fall
Dr. John Hink, an ER physician, rushed to the scene to aid the injured, with 55 people rescued in under two hours
Survivor Gary Babineau helped rescue children from a school bus and assisted others to safety amidst the chaos
Melissa Hughes experienced a vehicle landing on her car during the collapse but emerged unharmed
24521a2abb2e1f5e34e6824e0f9e56904a2b0e88:
Doctors removed five small polyps from President Bush's colon, none of which appeared worrisome
Vice President Dick Cheney assumed presidential powers during Bush's colonoscopy procedure
Results from the polyp examination are expected within two to three days
President Bush resumed activities at Camp David post-procedure, including briefings and a bike ride
